Mathematical Introduction to Deep Learning: Methods, Implementations, and Theory

This document provides a mathematical introduction to deep learning, covering methods, implementations, and theory. It is written by Arnulf Jentzen, Benno Kuckuck, and Philippe von Wurstemberger and aims to provide an in-depth understanding of the subject. The book covers topics such as stochastic gradient descent, optimization, and artificial neural networks. It also includes Python source codes that can be downloaded from the arXiv page or GitHub repository.

Key Concepts:

  • Mathematical Introduction to Deep Learning
  • Methods
  • Implementations
  • Theory
  • Leaky ReLU
  • Exponential Linear Unit (ELU)
  • Rectified Power Unit (RePU)
  • Lyapunov-type functions
  • Gronwall differential inequalities
  • ODEs
deep learning artificial neural network stochastic gradient descent optimization activation functions neural networks convexity monotonicity subgradients strong convexity
